result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth R. Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Criminal Thinking.  Not to go to Viking Express, Wal-Mart, or Kwik Wash all in  Baraboo.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth R. Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenneth R. Williams in court with attorney Debra V. O'Rourke.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  State notes 14CF314 is simply an initial appearance today.  14CT9 is a motion to revoke DPA for violating deferred w/fine only recommendation.  Atty O'Rourke agrees/acknowledges rec. complaint in 14CF314.  State agrees to signature bond in 14CF314 w/booking.  Court orders signature bond of $1,000.00 in 14CF314 and DE must be booked on 11/12/2014 at 1pm.  Atty O'Rourke waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Atty O'Rourke agrees to revocation of DP in 14CT9.  Court grants motion to revoke DPA in 14CT9 and judgment is entered.  Court sentences on that matter.  State states recs.  Atty O'Rourke states DE will waive prelim in 14CF261 and 14CF209.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waivers/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Atty O'Rourke enters NC pleas per agreement.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  VIS reviewed.  State makes statement.  Atty O'Rourke make statement.  DE makes brief statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE of felony firearm warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

$379.00 fine/costs to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
